Text: To You, O LORD, I call; be not deaf to me, O Rock. Do not be silent, or I will be like those who go down to the pit.
Context: David calls out to God in urgent prayer, fearing abandonment and death.

Text: Hear the sound of my pleading when I cry to You for help, lifting up my hands toward Your Most Holy place.
Context: David continues his plea, physically expressing his earnest request for God’s attention.

Text: Do not drag me away with the wicked, with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace to their neighbors while malice is in their hearts.
Context: David asks for differentiated judgment, separating him from the wicked who are duplicitous.

Text: Repay them according to their deeds and the malice of their actions; repay them according to the work of their hands; render them their due reward.
Context: David calls for retributive justice against the wicked based on their actions.

Text: Because they do not regard the works of the LORD or the deeds of His hands, He will tear them down and not rebuild them.
Context: David speaks of the wicked‘s lack of consideration for God’s works, which leads to their downfall.

Text: Blessed be the LORD, for He has heard the sound of my pleading.
Context: David expresses joy and relief at God‘s attentive response to his prayers.

Text: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in Him, and I am helped. Therefore my heart rejoices, and with my song I will thank Him.
Context: David acknowledges God as his protector; trust in God brings assistance and elicits joy and gratitude.

Text: The LORD is the strength of His people, a fortress of salvation for His anointed one.
Context: David affirms God’s role as the source of strength and defense for himself and God‘s people.

Text: Save Your people and bless Your inheritance; be their shepherd and carry them forever.
Context: David ends with a prayer for God’s continued care and guidance for His people, evoking the image of God as a shepherd.
